metadata.title: Convert Atmospheres to PSI – Pressure Converter
metadata.description: Convert pressure from Atmospheres (atm) to PSI (Pounds per Square Inch), useful for equipment specifications.

introduction: This converter transforms pressure measurements from Atmospheres to PSI, bridging scientific and practical units.
Equipment specifications mix atmospheres and PSI depending on source and region.
This converter uses the standard relationship where 1 atmosphere equals approximately 14.696 PSI.
methodology: 1 atm ≈ 14.696 PSI. To convert atmospheres to PSI, multiply by 14.696. For example, 1 atm ≈ 14.7 PSI, 10 atm ≈ 147 PSI.
Diving and pressure equipment specifications often use both units depending on manufacturer.
Understanding pressure in different units is essential for equipment safety and compatibility.
This converter provides precise pressure conversions.
examples: Example 1 – Diving: 1 atmosphere of pressure at sea level = 14.696 PSI.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from Atmospheres to PSI?
faqs.answer: 1 atm ≈ 14.696 PSI. Multiply atmospheres by 14.696 to get PSI.

glossary.definition: Pressure unit based on standard sea-level atmospheric pressure.
Pounds per Square Inch, imperial unit of pressure.
